column4: What package do I install under Edgy to get mint (the Mono interpreter)? It used to be mono-mint, but that package doesn't exist any more.
search for mono in synaptic
I've installed every mono package I can find and it's still not there.
what are you looking for?
an application that can run a mono program?
I'm looking for a specific program: mint. The program I'm trying to compile fails at configure complaining that it can't find mint.
sudo apt-get install linux-source-`uname -r`
sudo apt-get install build-essential
was mint ever in the reopsitories?
It was in a previous version of Ubuntu.
you in feisty now?
No. Edgy
please paste the entire pastebin of ./configure
Sorry, I forget how to use pastebin
Thanks. See sudo apt-get install linux-source-`uname -r`
I mean http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/14733/
ya i know that wont work, did you get it?
sudo apt-get install monodevelop
Yeah, I did so, but I need a newer version
sudo apt-get install libmono-dev mono-devel
Aha! libmono-dev did it. Thanks!
kitche Thanks for your help.
